author: My Poppy, Eve
comment: The entire movie she was begging for him to be friends with her. It was because he was the first person to even recognize her in school. She didn't know he was being mean. And honestly, neither did he. He didn't know why such mean words came out of his mouth. And out of embarrassment, he decided to bully her.   Years later, he apologized, and although timid at first, she still cared about him. The hardships. The grief. The pain. The guilt. The need to end it all.  The burning desire of wanting to tell someone you love them but they wouldn't be able to understand it.  That's life...

author: Nicolas Lorenzen
comment: We all know that bullying is bad. We all know that suicide is not the way either for escape. The real emotion here that gets the worst of us in terms of both characters is grief and a lack of self respect and appreciation. Grief, is a horrible feeling. Nothing is worse than the intense sorrow which haunts you and breaks your down as you get older. It eats you up, as well as the people you know who you interact with daily. Learn to deal with that grief if you have it. Its never to late. But who am I to say these things. My eyes are but only green and locked with sorrow -Just another Art Degree Student.

author: Akil Srirama
comment: Hey Kaylee, I'm not sure if you're going to see this, and I don't know how to tell you with all of the communication restrictions but I just wanted to say that I really like you and want to try this and make it work even with the distance. I think we are old enough to decide for ourselves what is right and wrong, we're 16 and I want to wait but I don't know how because communication is so important and that's all we have but we can't even talk or text. I'm not sure if you want to wait for your dad to change his mind or text somehow but that's all up to you and how much you want to. I don't want to just let something like this go or fade and maybe I get attached quickly or I don't know you but we get along so well and you get me and actually laugh at my jokes even if they aren't funny and have a great sense of humor and have such a great personality and how you don't care too much and how I can just be myself around you plus soo much more and I feel like it would be a missed or wasted opportunity to let it go. I really enjoy your company and it was the highlight of my day to play or talk with you, even if it was just for a few minutes at the end of the day but I don't know if that's just me and maybe fell too hard in a situation that sucks but I can't control that. But at the same time, it could be the fear of missing out or finding someone else like you and also I think you deserve someone who is there physically for you rather than someone like me in a different country. lol sorry for the dump but I just needed to get that off my chest and off my mind and couldn't find the time or bring myself to telling you. I just want to know your opinion on this or what you think we should do and il be completely behind it :)

author: Leo Marrufo
comment: Since you were a baby, I love you. I taught you to walk, to talk and I hugged you so much.. you didn't realize it was Me, but it was Me. It's true, you got away from Me, but I NEVER got away from you. Who told you that I am a punishing Father and that I just sit and do nothing to save you and to save this world? Remember, son (daughter): I am still in control of everything you see and believe it or not, my goal to change this world still stands. But my main goal is you. If you feel pain and do not understand why so many things happen.. Do not hesitate to come to Me, I really know how you feel and what you are going through, and remember, it is not that I do nothing to change it.. because there is no storm that lasts forever and the darker the night, the sooner the dawn comes. I know that sometimes it is very difficult to understand things and I understand you, believe me I do. Tell me everything you feel with your words even if you think you don't know how to do it, because from the first time you stopped to think about who I was, I heard you. And no matter how distant it was, do not see how important it was for Me.. Or if even many criticize you for doing it.. Here I will be and we will go through shame together. I will not stop showing you all my help and all my Infinite Love that no one else can feel for you, as I have done from day 1. Here I am and I want to save you. Do not forget.. - That is God who has spoken to you through my comment, because he knew that you needed to know and what he hopes the most is that no matter how difficult this moment is, go and leave everything that does not allow you to speak with Him, because believe it or not, He still has something prepared for you. Go and make it possibleâ¤ï¸

author: Alice Shirka
comment: To those who is reading this. If u ever had a thought of committing suicide, do remember. Back when u were in ur mother's womb u were the chosen sperm to enter the ovum. Ur siblings gave their lives for u to have a chance to live as a child. So live to the fullest. The food u ate are from the animals. They sacrifice themselves for u to live another day. So live to the fullest. The house that u are living is build by many trees. So live to the fullest. Don't make their sacrifices be in vain. Do not be afraid for what will happen next. Life is only ones, if u felt like it isn't a good life or a boring life to u, make it interesting just like me. Making others feeling the joy u couldn't experience is actually an interesting thing. So live to the fullest, spread love as u don't want to see others having the same problem u have. Now that it isn't too late, enjoy what u have now and cherish whichever besides u. They may be the ones who hurts u, but there is always a chance for them to realise. So do whatever u can, don't care of others thoughts on u because they don't know who u really am. Only u know who u are and so is God. Do whatever is best to u and be happy and live to the fullest. Don't be afraid of the future :)

author: Firren
comment: I did really enjoy this movie but at the same time it made me mad, because it's just not realistic. In real life she would've stood up for herself at least once or asked from help from someone and maybe not, but she sure as hell wouldn't go out of her way to be extra nice to the people that bully her and cause her pain. Like that dude too, of course he can feel bad about everything after it all happened but I just can't wrap my head around that he later goes on to learn sign language and If the girl was so nice to him when he bullied her why did she run away crying when he came back to apologize when they were older? maybe she was a masochist lol but after they grew up they should've gotten over it, he apologized and she or forgives him or doesn't. but I can't believe they became friends after that. now don't fight me on this it's just my personal opinion, it was a great movie with a beautiful art style but I just got mad every time the characters did something like this.

author: JustARandomGirl vx
comment: Shouko ran away crying when he showed up, because she was scared. She is traumatized. Trauma leaves wounds that is why she didn't move on. Yes she was nice to him when he bullied her, but that was because she needed to make the best out of her circumstances. She wasn't able to just escape from, because she needs to go to school every day Now that she is somewhere else, she has the possibility to run away from him without consequences, if she did it at her old school, he would have bullied her for that too. But here she mustn't see him again.

author: Team Verex
comment: idk how many people need to hear this but:    dear teenagers,  you're only a teenager for 2.555 days  that's 364 more fridays after school  7 more summers  So be a teenager  tell that guy/girl you like him/her  cut your hair  try new things  go outside  watch the sunset  hug your parents  buy that shirt  make new friends  compliment others  be kind   go to parties   watch that horror movie  sneak out  learn how to drive  laugh your ass off  blast your music  glow up  play with makeup   have sleepovers   have a movies night  take pictures   try new food  be that girl/guy  make memories    these are the years we'll remember most. Make yourself proud that you lived your teenage years. Change the world and don't take any day for granted because everyday could be your last.    (this is inspired by kara cardwell from tiktok)    Edit: I'm sorry I wrote it to late bc now everyone has online school: home schooling bc of corona ğŸ‘‰ğŸ¼ğŸ‘ˆğŸ¼ğŸ˜… But don't worry we'll get through it and I hope that no one gets it anymore. please stay Safe and don't go out if not needed.      edit 2: Things to do at home while quarantine:    - do Skin care  - buy things online if you need so you don't have to go out  - Clean your room  - do your school work  - face time your friends, I'm sure they miss you too :)  - text each other  - glow up  - dye your hair  - cut your hair  - watch movies at home  - listen to your fav music  - do a home workout ( I prever chloe ting)  - draw  - Bake cookies (like I did :D)  - watch youtube videos  - relax  - watch memes  - organize your closet   - sing out loud   - play games   - read a book   - try out new things you'd never thought you'd do (maybe you even like it)  - take hot baths to relax  take care of yourself and stay healthy!!! You matter so don't waste this time you need to take a break from all and enjoy everything you do, even if it's not what you wanted.    if you're not feeling well or just want to talk about something, reply to this. I reply to everyone. And to everyone who's reading this, bless your Soul and I hope you'll get better soon if you don't feel well!

author: Aryan Kumar
comment: 100 Reasons Why You Should Stay Alive   1. Your friends, your family, and your pets would miss you.  2. It's not worth the regret. Either by yourself if you failed or just simply left scars, or the regret everyone else feels by not doing enough to help you.   3. It does get better. Believe it or not it will eventually get better. Sometimes you have to go through the storm to get to the rainbow.   4. There's so much you would miss out on doing.   5. There is always a reason to live. It might not be clear right now, but it is always there.   6. So many people care, and it would hurt them if you hurt yourself.   7. You ARE worth it. Don't let anyone, especially yourself, tell you otherwise.   8. You are amazing.   9. A time will come, once you've battled the toughest times of your life and are in ease once again, where you will be so glad that you decided to keep on living. You will emerge stronger from this all, and won't regret your choice to carry on with life. Because things always get better.   10. What about all the things you've always wanted to do? What about the things you've planned, but never got around to doing? You can't do them when you're dead.   11. I love you. Platonically. Even if only one person loves you, that's still a reason to stay alive.   12. You won't be able to listen to music if you die.   13. Killing yourself is never worth it. You'll hurt both yourself and all the people you care about.   14. There are so many people that would miss you, including me.   15. You're preventing a future generation, YOUR KIDS, from even being born.   16. How do you think your family would feel? Would it improve their lives if you died?   17. You're gorgeous, amazing, handsome, and to someone you are perfect.   18. Think about your favourite music artist, you'll never hear their voice again...   19. You'll never have the feeling of walking into a warm building on a cold day.   20. Listening to incredibly loud music.  21. Being alive is just really good.   22. Not being alive is really bad. And boring.  23. Finding your soulmate.   24. Red pandas. Justâ€¦ THEY ARE SO CUTE!!  25. Going to diners at three in the morning.   26. Really soft pillows. Or blankets.  27. Eating pizza in New York City.   28. Proving people wrong with your success. Take that!  29. Watching the jerks that doubted you fail at life. Take that!  30. Seeing someone trip over a garbage can.  31. Being able to help other people.   32. Bonfires.   33. Sitting on rooftops.   34. Seeing every single country in the world. And not being ignored. Because, yâ€™know, if you were dead everyone would run into youâ€¦ it would suck.  35. Going on roadtrips. Have fun doing that as a ghost, or whatever.  36. You might win the lottery someday, who knows! How would you enter while youâ€™re dead?!  37. Listening to music in your own special place.  38. Going to the top of the Eiffel Tower, staring down at everyone with the wind in your hair.  39. Taking really cool pictures.  40. Literally meeting thousands of new people.  41. Hearing crazy stories.   42. Telling crazy stories.  43. Eating ice cream on a hot day with your best friends.  44. More interesting books or episodes could come out, you never know. Itâ€™s gonna be hard to get books or watch Netflix/Hulu/Etc while youâ€™re dead.  45. Travelling to another planet someday. Itâ€™s gonna happen.  46. Having an underwater house.  47. Randomly running into your hero on the street  48. Having your own room at a fancy hotel.  49. Trampolines.  50. Think about your favourite movie, you'll never watch it again.  51. Think about the feeling of laughing out loud in a public place because your best friend has just sent you an inside joke.  52. Your survival will make the world better, even if it's for just one person or 20 or 100 or more.   53. People do care.   54. Treehouses, you wonâ€™t really be able to have a treehouse while dead.  55. Hanging out with your soulmate in a treehouse   55. Snorting when you laugh and not caring who sees.   56. I love you. Platonically.  57. I care about you.   58. Because nobody is going to be like you ever, so embrace your uniqueness!   59. You won't be here to experience the first cat world emperor. You wonâ€™t even be influenced by it.  60. WHAT ABOUT FOOD?! YOU'LL MISS CHOCOLATE AND ALL THE OTHER NOM THINGS!  61. Starbucks. Or caribou coffee.  62. Hugs. The kind that make you squeal because of how tight they are, the kind that you really love.   63. Stargazing with your favorite person in this universe at 4am because you canâ€™t sleep, the grass brushing against your toes as you snuggle together.  64. You have a purpose, and it's up to you to find out what it is.   65. You've changed somebody's life.   66. Now you could change the world.   67. You will meet the person that's perfect for you. Maybe you already have.  68. No matter how much or how little, you have your life ahead of you.   69. You canâ€™t look at any more memes if you're dead.  70. If you end your life, you're stopping yourself from achieving great things.  71. Making snow angels.   72. Making snowmen.   73. Snowball fights.   74. Life is what you make of it.   75. Everybody has a talent.   76. Laughing until you cry, with your stomach screaming and your lungs flaring in heat. Rolling on the floor, grinning ear to ear.  77. Having the ability to be sad means you have the ability to be happy.   78. The world would not be the same if you didn't exist.   79. Itâ€™s possible to turn frowns upside down.   80. Be yourself, don't take anyone's crap, and never let them take you alive.   81. Heroes are ordinary people who make themselves extraordinary. Be your own hero.   82. Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.   83. One day your smile will be real. It will, I promise you.  84. Having a really hot, relaxing bath after a stressful day.   85. Lying on grass and laughing at the clouds.   86. Laughing insanely hard with your best friends.   87. Eating weird food.   88. Staying up all night watching your favourite films with a loved one.   89. Sleeping in all day.   90. Creating something you're proud of.   91. You can look back on yourself 70 years later and being proud that you didn't commit. And if you did, feeling regret that you did.  92. Being able to meet your Internet friends.   u93. Coffee.  94. The new season of your favorite show.   95. Staying up late with your best friend.  96. Being stupid in public because you just can.   97. If you are reading this then you are alive! Is there any more reason to smile?   98. Being able to hug that one person you havenâ€™t seen in years   99. People care enough about you and your future to come up with 100 reasons for you not to do this.   100. But, the final and most important one is just being able to experience life. Because even if your life doesn't seem so great right now, literally anything could happen.  This is not mine I'm just passing this comment when I feel down Especially when locked indoors Have a Nice Quarantine People.

author: Sinnamon Roll
comment: The rooftop scene reminds me of the death of one of my characters (His (English) name is Casey.) in his future. He is deaf and was unable to make any friends due to his gender identity and disability. He tried and tried. He made six friends, one of which became his boyfriend. He (Zachary) believes that he's the reason why Casey had no friends. He decides to kill himself, Casey was Ishida and Zachary was Shoko. Casey didn't have much body strength, but he held onto Zachary's arm and refused to let go. As soon as Zachary put his hand on the railing, Casey's guard was let down. He let go and fell over the rooftop's railing. He saved Zachary's life... while ending his own.  Zachary was devastated. The only reason he kept smiling was because of Casey.

author: Melanie Ribeiro
comment: There is hope in Jesus Christ! If you think you are never going to be happy, that you will never get out of depression and that heavy, heavy cloud that's upon you will never leave you, then I have the pleasure to tell you otherwise. I too was once so depressed...I too cried when I was alone and pretended to be happy around other people, while I was dying inside...I too had many suicidal thoughts...But Jesus saved me. Many of you might not believe in God, but He is more than real. I once was crying so, so bad in bed, while everyone was asleep, trying to deal with the pain in my chest...I thought that I couldn't do it anymore and that's when I cried out for Jesus! And little did I know that, that was the best decision I took and I'm not even kidding. Jesus IS hope and IS love, because that night I got so, so calmed and felt so, so LOVED. And since that day my whole depression vanished and I got healed from everything that was hurt inside me. When I was depressed, I tried everything to feel happy, to take that emptiness of me, but NOTHING WORKED, not even a relationship, except God.  If you feel like that, please do not hesitate on calling out for Him, even if you don't believe in God do it please. If you don't believe in Him, ask Him to reveal Himself to you, you will be surprised, but you have to do it with an open heart. Jesus is not about religion, but He's all about a relationship with you. He LOVES YOU SO MUCH and knows what you're going through. He just wants to heal you and your soul. Jesus saves. He's coming back soon ( everything that's happening in the world right now are signs of His returning). I'm just a nobody trying to tell everybody, all about Somebody who saved my soul <3

author: á´Šá´‡É´É´Éªá´‡ á´‹Éªá´.
comment: Hi. I'm deaf as well. I'm just 16 and I've also tried giving up on life multiple times for the same reasons. I was diagnosed with an extremely rare syndrome (Usher's Syndrome Type 2) just a few months ago and it's really brought me down.  As part of the deaf community, we are constantly going through struggles and no one understands how hard it is for us. I understand and get you though, as someone who is also just like you. The thing is, I shouldn't have to state I'm deaf and get you. EVERYONE should. You deserve to be understood and treated fairly despite being 'different' and so does everyone else, regardless of physical or not disabilities.   You're so beautiful, do you know that?   I don't need to see your face to know that. Twenty years of endurance and fighting tells me that. You're so strong and I hope you realise that. Your differences make you stronger individually and you should see your deafness as a blessing, not a curse. Being deaf means we appreciate what we can do and hear and see more than anyone else. Don't give up, beautiful. I'm here if you ever need to talk.

author: Nezsuki-Chan
comment: This song really hit me...     I am an emotional person, VERY EMOTIONAL. No one in my family or even close friends know anything about me when they can write a whole book about me. I keep everything secret, I cry myself to sleep some nights... At school I try to fit in but people just call me annoying, my crush kept rejecting me but on the outside, I still kept a smile. Throughout the years it would hurt to smile cause I've done it for so long. If anyone knew what I was going through they would try to get me some help. `Heart made of glass my mind of stone` `Tear me to pieces, skin to bone.` It's a full description of my life at this moment. I've always thought of committing suicide but I'm too weak to do anything..

author: sad girl hours
comment: This reminds me when I tried committing suicide 8-10 times. Iâ€™m weak so I canâ€™t legitimately do it, anyways, Iâ€™m not dead but I used to be discriminated for crying and being sensitive due to overwhelming anxiety. People tended to call me the crybaby or the freak or whatever.   Due to that, I didnâ€™t have much friends, but 5th grade was the worse.. I dated this girl in 5th grade and I thought she loved me, I thought about her all the time but the only thing she would do is say â€œYOUR DEPRESSION IS SPREADING ONTO MEâ€ â€œYOURE HARASSING MEâ€, she got mad at me once for losing something of hers and Iâ€™m a forgetful person, she decided to pout and be mad at me for the entire day, I kept apologizing.  The first commition: Took my hoodie wires and tied them around my neck. I got sent home because I was dumb for doing that in front of the entire classroom. My â€œfriendsâ€ decided to YELL at me for doing that.   Second: Did the same exact thing.  Third-Eighth: Strangling myself with my phone cord wire..  Ninth: Stabbing myself with a screwdriver  Tenth: Tried bleeding myself out.      After that, I was sent to a mental facility, I got sent there for my suicidal behavior & because I couldnâ€™t be safe at home, especially with her emotionally abusing me to almost my death.  â€œHeart made of glass, my mind of stone.â€ â€œTear me to pieces, skin to bone.â€  I have sensitive emotions and my mind thinks I can be tough but after I leave the argument, I cry my heart out.  I got too used to it that I just wanted to break loose from everything and not feel and dealt with the pain Iâ€™ve been going through.   Crying, countless nights, abusing my own self psychically while being emotionally + verbally abused. Some points I felt numb to cry because I didnâ€™t want to worry other individuals.    And it was like I was stuck in a memory mind prison, repeating every memory, every bad memory, I felt like I couldnâ€™t unlock the prison to release my emotions.  It was constant pain, I started to question myself with my own sanity wondering if I was the one doing something wrong, me questioning if I was overreacting, me questioning my own self-worth.    I started to think everyone was a background character even if they were the main people in my life, I felt alone and wanted to be alone. The pain of crying feels like someoneâ€™s suffocating me and trying to stab my chest multiple times.   My mind and mental health canâ€™t be cleared as long as I take medication Iâ€™ll be fine...

author: satobi
comment: not only the movie makes me cry but all the AMV about it makes me cry too. i want to write something: it was never my intention to bully, but its known that i hurt some people, and in a certain point i feel like Ishida. at the end of the last year at highschool, no one talked to me, i was on my own, i didnt know where i was going to end. my life was into darkness, i was completely alone. theres was no one i could talk to about my feelings, and i couldnt even apologise because no one wanted to hear me, centainly my voice was a sound to ignore. til today, i have no confidence when it comes to talk to someone, its like im not ready to making new friends and seeing people around who trust me. seeing this movie made me thought a lot about what i did. 2 years have passed, but i still looking for a better me, hoping to known someone capable of makes me feel like im on the right way... at this point, im not waiting for forgiveness, just wishing all my old schoolmates are being happy! i probably deserved to being ignored, but i dont wish to anyone being bullied, thats the reason why from the very begging, we should treat each other with kindness and respect.

author: Aldrin Collo
comment: When I was 9, I used to bully this girl. She has no parents.(I'm the worst) Years passed by something terrible happened to me My mother died in accident without me saying sorry. (we fought before she dies..) As a kid I'm unable to move on I gradually change as a person who become silent, looking down, unable to look at the face of people.(same as the movie)  Because of that I got bullied.  I finally understand how it feels to be bullied.  *4 years later*  first class and I'm not listening to the cookery lectures as a lonely boy who draws manga on his notes.  on the side of my notes someone just draw something. and I was shocked...  It was the girl who I used to bully before   and GODDAMN! *she's gorgeous.*   I can't look her in her eyes then. she wrote   listen to the class!.  I grin,  look at the whiteboard and she's sitting next to me.  She is trying to talk to me because I look sad.  Then I said. Do you remember me?     She said: ofcourse ur my classmate in preschool.  I said that :  *I used to bully you. you know.*     *speaking in a little tone   and then she said that Yeah..  *It is so akward. but the teacher scold the two of us because were noisy.  I began to talk to her. and I said sorry. (she don't remember all of my bullying just few, a topple on my forehead and she forgave me.) Didn't expect we have the same hobby. gaming, drawing manga, and traveling. long story short.  *We've been together for 6 years until now.*

author: KIM JISOO
comment: I feel like Iâ€™m a human version of this girl. Iâ€™m deaf, and wear hearing aids too. Iâ€™ve tried committing suicide. Iâ€™ve been ridiculed. Iâ€™ve been discriminated. Iâ€™ve even been punched in the ear when I was younger and just wanted to be friends with the person who did it. This movie really hits differently when youâ€™re actually just like the girl. It made me cry because at last, someone understood and made a beautiful movie about it.       Edit: The punching happened in year three so I was 7. When I came home I told my mum and burst into tears. She took my hearing aid out and I swear blood just came pouring out my ear and stained my uniform, he punched me that hard. When I was 14 a boy decided it would be funny to push me down a steep hill and I nearly broke my neck. Came back to my mumâ€™s car (she was waiting for me and I was picking up my little brother from football practice) and she saw the mud on my uniform and when I told her what happened she broke down. Heâ€™d done it as a â€œjokeâ€ to his friends who were there with him. He recently hit me up on Instagram saying hi, but Iâ€™ve ignored it. Iâ€™ve even been discriminated or made fun of by adults. Honestly sometimes I feel like the beauty of life is slipping away from me slowly.

author: Abhishek Kumar Gorai
comment: I don't know why but somewhere I do relate to Shouya Ishida. From childhood I was a bully and as I grew up I started to feel all those people who used to be with me laugh with me for bullying other are now despising me and created a path away from me. Now as I have grown I have lost contacts with everyone although I'm not a bully anymore as I was in my childhood but I don't have any friends either no one to talk or to spend time with. At a point in my life its really difficult to get go with life looking others enjoying and you don't I was cheerful as a kid not anymore all those things I did hit me now everytime I see my friends enjoy. That's why I'm telling with my personal experience if you're a bully stop it or else you'll just be alone in the end and it's freakin hard to live this way!!!

author: Gabriel Yon
comment: Damn this makes me think about my past and what i have done. It's been tearing me up throughout my highschool years rn. I relate to that man so much and i wish i could of changed myself from who i was then and now. My girlfriend was victimized just like that girl and i can't help but feel like i did it to her even though it wasn't her i was bullying back then. I just hope that girl i bullied didn't try to kill herself and i hope she can move on from everything i did. For some people or my girlfriend at least they don't move on. I can never apologize to this girl because i never seen her again after elementary school. I turned into that boy that he is now as you see throughout the ending point in the movie but i never forgave myself and i hate myself and blame myself i can't look people in the eyes I'm afraid that I'll hurt someone again

author: CrixPlayZ
comment: Before I mention anything, it is best advised to watch the entire video without skipping, this is not any ordinary video as it is now one of my favourite video of all time. And I suggest you read the entire comment to understand. I also am no way into romanticism, or intrested into it. This video is based off a movie called silent voice. As if you have read many comments, you'd see that many people claim they sobbed. The morale of this entire movie and video is this: in today's world, people are liked because of their wealth, popularity rather than their personality. The girl in the video that made many people sob is the fact that she was deaf and never stopped liking him, not because of his wealth or anything, but out of pure curiosity. And the boy being anti boredom, hated her. This sadly is the reality in today's world. I personally am in no such relationship and I won't be one since people call me a nerd (no one even likes nerd these days lol), but this currently is the reality we live in, in this generation where people are turned down. I'll br honest, I felt silent watching this video many times. And I believe it has to do something with me as it was posted on a very important day to me as I planned on something that day. I've watched the movie twice in a row on friday, and this video liek 8 times. It really made me think about my decisions up to now. I hope the video montage cheers you all up, xx

author: Molly Watkins
comment: When I watched the movie, it felt really personal to me. I'm not deaf, but I am autistic and have aspergers (high-functioning). People who don't know me may think of me as off and as a little kid, they just called me weird and bullied me a lot. I lost my trust in people. It got to the point where I wanted to k*** myself or just not be autistic because of how others saw me. I watched this after KyoAni burnt down (this plus re-watched MKDM) and it made me sob. The whole time I felt the girl's pain, but in a different light. I'm not deaf or blind, but in a way I do see the world a little more different.
